# Data process
## Cuba 
### Wave 1 

#### Study-specific variable description

 

| **Name** | `PMARRY`|
|-|-|
| **Label** | `marital status`|
| **Table name** | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` |
| **Categories** | `1 = never married`<br/>`2 = married/ cohabitating`<br/>`3 = widowed`<br/>`4 = divorced/ separated` |
| **Missings** | `NA` |
| **Description** |  | 






```{r assign_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1_ms','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',
                         variables=list('PMARRY'), missings = TRUE)
```

```{r local_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
t1066_cuba_w1_ms <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1_ms')
vari <- t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[2], caption = attributes(vari)$`spss::shortName`)
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = NA)[1], caption = "Category")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1_ms, aes(x=factor(PMARRY))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("Marital Status") + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `keep "never married" into 1`
* `keep "married/ cohabiting" into 2`
* `recode 3 "widowed" into 4`
* `recode 4 "divorced/separated" into 3`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_cuba1,   echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1_ms$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY, "3=4; 4=3; NA=999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status, labels = c("single"=1, "married cohabitating"=2, "divorced separated"=3, "widow"=4, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
vari <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = "marital_status") 
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Type of missing")

ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(marital_status))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab("marital status") + ylab("Frequency")
```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation_cuba1,  echo=FALSE}
BeforeH <- c(table(t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY), sum(is.na(t1066_cuba_w1_ms$PMARRY)))
AfterH <- table(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$marital_status)[c(1, 2, 4, 3, 5)]
C <- rbind(BeforeH,AfterH)
colnames(C) <- c("1","2", "4->3", "3->4", "NA->999")
kable(C)
```

* `keep "married/ cohabiting" into 2`
* `recode 3 "widowed" into 4`
* `recode 4 "divorced/separated" into 3`

**R script:**

```{r harmo_PR2,   echo=TRUE}
t1066_ds_PR_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_PR_w2_ms$id)
t1066_ds_PR_w2$marital_status <- car::recode(t1066_PR_w2_ms$f_PMARRY, "3=4; 4=3; NA=999")
t1066_ds_PR_w2$marital_status <- labelled(t1066_ds_PR_w2$marital_status, labels = c("single"=1, "married cohabitating"=2, "divorced separated"=3, "widow"=4, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not attempt not done"=994, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not applicable"=996, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

Percentages of categories in each harmonised variable:




```{r helpfunctions, echo=F}


labelling <- function(l.hds,m.hds){
  
  # Labelling of the tibbles with categorical data and creating new tibbles with all missings recodified as NA

  for(name in names(l.hds)) {
    # In the aux_object we copy the old tibble to recodify all missing values as NA.
    aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
    # Labelling of variables
    label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label
    # Labelling of categories (for continues variables, only missing values)
    l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cat_label)
    aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
    # Labelling of categories (for categorical variables, only non-missing values)
    aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cat_label[1:4])
  # Saving the recodified tibble in list m.hds
    m.hds[[name]] <- aux_object
    rm(aux_object)
  }
  return(list(l.hds,m.hds))

}

# Creation of summary tables for categorical data

summaries <- function(l.hds,m.hds,lnames){

  # Creation of columns with categories and labels
  t.hds <- frq(l.hds[[1]][2])[[1]][,c(1,2)] 
  # For each wave/population in l.hds, add the correponding values
  for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
    t.hds[2+i] <- frq(l.hds[[i]][2])[[1]][,4] 
  }
  # Add sample size for each wave/population
  t.hds[15,] <- c("n", "sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))
  )
  # Add wave/population names
  names(t.hds)<-c("val", "label",lnames)
  return(t.hds)
  
}

# Save data tables

savingRD <- function(l.hds,vbl_name){
  
  for(index in seq_along(l.hds)){
    assign(vbl_name,l.hds[[index]])
    save(vbl_name,list = vbl_name, file = paste0(datafolder,names(l.hds)[index],"/",vbl_name,".RData"))
  }

}

```
